line.en: The last day of term.
That night.
'Aoi, I'm sorry to ask this but could you wash\nthis bath towel?'
'Sure, could you just put it in the wash basket?'
'Thank you!'
'The air conditioner in my room doesn't work very\nwell.'
'I'll call an electrician, during the summer and\nhave them take a look.'
'Thanks!'
'Um...there's no breakfast tomorrow morning is\nthere?'
'If you're here then I'll make something'
'Oh, yes please...'
Everyone is busy.
Of course they are, all of the boarders are\nheading home for the summer.
The ones that are leaving early will be going\nback tomorrow.
'It's so hot! I''m dying...'
Holding a fan in one hand, Kanako comes out of\nthe dressing room.
...in her underwear.
'Whoa there Kanako!'
'Maybe I should turn on the air conditioner in\nthe hallway.'
'Just because it's so hot, it doesn't mean you\nshould be walking around in your underwear.'
'But I get so sweaty! My shirt sticks to me and\nit feels horrible... Whew, it's so hot.'
She mutters to herself as she enters the dining\nhall.
'Geez...'
'Quaaack!'
This time, Hat comes walking out with a limp from\nKotori's Room.
'What's up? Is the heat geting to you? After I've\nfinished cleaning up, I'll spray some water on\nyou so just hold on a minute.'
'Quack!...'
I, the dorm mother, have to get ready to see\neveryone off. So of course, I'm a little busy.
That's why I left to come home halfway through\ntoday's club activities.
'Quack?'
Drained of strength and completely exhausted, Hat\nsensed something and suddenly raised his head.
'I'm home!'
'Welcome back. You're a little late, aren't you?'
'I stayed right till the end. Whew... I'm\nbeat...'
'Quack, quack!'
'OK, OK, I'm home now, Hat.'
Kotori, who was exhausted, picked up Hat and put\nhim on her lap.
'It's so hot... I'm really thirsty...'
'OK, I got it.'
I pushed the wheelchair, and took Kotori into the\ndining hall.
'Welcome back, Kotori. Looks like you've been\nworking hard.'
'Yeah, kind of.'
'Is barley tea OK?'
'Yeah, thanks.'
'Glug, glug... Aaah... I've come back to life!'
'Do you want something to eat?'
'Yes please.'
I take the dinner I had prepared and heat it up\nin the microwave.
'What a hero!'
'It's all part of being the dorm mother.'
As of today, Kotori and the others have already\nstarted 'camping'.
I couldn't stay till the end because I had dorm\nmother jobs to do. So, I felt bad and apologized\nabout this and that.
But that ends today.
From tomorrow, I will be freed from these duties!
'(I have to do the maintenance and administration\nfor the building though.)'
However, there's no doubt about it -- I'll be\nable to take part in the camping.
'Whoa! It's so spicy!'
Kotori makes a real racket while eating her\nsesame, miso, and chili oil noodles.
'Hat, get away from me! If you eat this, you'll\ndie for sure!'
'Quack! Quack!'
Kotori chases away Hat, who is after the\nvegetables in the noodles.
'Sluuuurp... So spicy!!!! It's delicious but so\nspicy!!'
It sounds like she's complaining but she also\nseems to like it.
'By the way, you're not going back home, are\nyou?'
I ask her.
'Sluuuurp... No, I'm not.'
'Did you cancel going back so that you could do\nthe camping thing?'
'Hmm? No, that's not it. That was my plan from\nthe beginning.'
'Really?'
Somehow, I'm not totally convinced and look at\nKotori.
'...This is hard to eat, though.'
'Oh, sorry.'
Kotori is disabled.
Thinking about it, she would probably spend her\nsummer holidays and so on at home.
It seems strange for her to be living here in the\ndormitory, away from her parents.
'(I wonder if there's a reason for it...?)'
As I vacantly think to myself about those kinds\nof things...
'I'm not going back either!'
'Whaaaat!?'
'...Why are you so surprised? Don't you want me\nhere?'
'No, it's not that...'
'My house is quite close to here. Actually, I\ncould come to this school without staying in the\ndormitory.'
'So why do you stay here?'
'I got kicked out...'
'Both my parents got remarried. I have a\nstep-brother who's a similar age to me...'
It somehow seems quite serious.
Kotori also subconsciously stops moving her\nchopsticks.
'I always walk around in my underwear after I get\nout of the bath, so my mother told me 'Get outta\nhere!''
'Are you trying to mess up my marriage, you\nungrateful so-and-so!?,' she said. Don't you\nthink that's mean?'
Kotori muttered 'What a waste of time it was\ntaking your story seriously...', as she went back\nto eating her food.
'Hmm, I think that's kind of your fault for\nwandering round in your underwear...'
Besides, after getting kicked out for that, she\ncame here only to do exactly the same thing.
'Well, I go there to show my face from time to\ntime. But basically, I'm gonna be staying here,\nso let's have a good time.'
Somehow, it looks like the boarders won't all be\nleaving for the summer after all.
'No, not like that! You're putting on too much\nresin!'
'Huh...!? If anything, it's too thin, isn't it?'
'If there's a high ratio of resin, it will lose\nstrength. I told you this before, didn't I?'
'But it's too thin, don't you think...?'
The first few days of 'camping'. The construction\nof the main wings was proceeding smoothly.
Ageha was focusing on the Robotics Club, and when\nshe had time, she would come to the garage to see\nus.
...and to quarrel with Kotori.
'Here, I'll show you how it's done.'
'Oh, Amane, what're you doing?'
'Yeah that's right, leave this to us. Please, go\nover there to cool off.'
'...Uh, but I wanted to join in too...'

Just like a grandmother who'd been treated like a
nuisance by her daughter and son-in-law, Amane,
looking downhearted, went back to where she was
before.
'Hey, you guys. Don't be mean to Amane.'
'We're not being mean... Are we?'
'That's right. We don't want it to fall apart in\nmidair when you or Amane are flying, so we're\njust being 'cruel to be kind'.'
Even so, it's not gonna fall apart in midair.
'It's fine. I would just...'
'See? You've knocked the confidence out of her.'
'OK, OK, please, help us over here. You can\npolish this finished part.'
'Is that alright?'
'Y-...Yeah... (Something like that can be redone\nlater...)'
'Hee hee hee, I'm gonna polish it!'
Amane throws herself into polishing a part that\nwas finished yesterday.
It's one of the huge plates.
It's built by joining several separately made\nplates.
It's the top part of the left wing and will be\nbonded to the underside part once it's complete.
Before that, we have to polish it until it's\nshiny. But, it takes a really long time.
That's because it has such a large surface area.
'It's so well made. Ageha, Kotori, you guys are\ngreat...'
She admires it as she polishes.
'...Yes, it looks like this will be a really good\naircraft.'
Listening to Amane talking to herself...
'Hee hee!'
'Eh heh heh...'
They both smile awkwardly.
For some reason, they're happiest when being\npraised by Amane.
'You guys seem to be having fun...'
I go to help too, but I don't get the same\nfeeling of actually making it as they do.
'What do you mean? When these wings are finished,\nyou're the one who's gonna be flying it.'
'That's right. You're the pilot.'
'Y-Yeah.'
Oh yeah.
These wings that everyone is working so hard to\nbuild, are what I will use to fly.
Riding on everyone's hopes...
As if words aren't enough, seeing everyone\nactually working on it like this, it really\nstarts to feel like that.
I never thought about that when I was riding a\nbike.
'(Bikes are also made by someone, piece by piece,\nand it's something they put their heart and soul\ninto...)'
At that time, I was simply obsessed with riding,\nand I guess I was still immature.
'OK, back to work!'
'Yeah! I wanna get this finished today!'
After being praised by Amane, they looked like\nthey were even more fired up.
Then, the sun went down.
About the same time, Ageha, who had been to the\nRobotics Club for a while, came back and said\n'Alright, here we go!
In other words, it's time to show what our\n'camping' here is all about.
'I'm comin' in!'
'Huh? An-chan?'
'Yo, Aoi.'
Carrying a big watermelon under his arm as he\ncame into the garage, was An-chan.
'...I'm coming in too.'
Behind him, was Hotaru.
'What's that, An-chan??'
'I was given it.'
'Your mom gave it to me, but I didn't think my\nfamily and I would be able to eat all of it. So,\nI brought it here.'
An-chan says 'Right?' as if asking Hotaru to\nconfirm his story.
Hotaru must be the one who brought that big\nwatermelon to An-chan's house.
Passing the watermelon to me, An-chan looks\naround the inside of the garage.
'Hey, it hasn't changed a bit... It's still messy\nand dirty.'
'An-chan, have you been here before?'
'Yeah, a long time ago.'
An-chan graduated from this school.
That's why it's not really that strange. But,\nthis garage is in a deserted place far from the\nschool building.
An-chan walks further inside.
Inside was Amane, muttering and looking at the\ndrawing board.
She was so deep in concentration, she didn't\nnotice at all what was going on.
'To reduce the drag, I guess we need curved\nsurfaces here...'
'Still the same old you, Amane.'
Realizing that An-chan was looking at her, Amane\nraised her head.
Her expression looked like she was completely\ntaken aback.
'Tatsuya...?'
'Yo.'
'Is that you, Tatsuya!?'
'It's been a while.'
As An-chan spoke to her, Amane got out of her\nchair and walked round and round him.
Then, she pats him on the shoulder...
'It really is you, Tatsuya! It's been such a long\ntime!'
'What? What? What's all this about?'
'I dunno...'
'That's what I wanna know too...'
It seems that these two are old acquaintances.
Hotaru starts cutting the watermelon with one of\nthe utility knives used in our work.
'This brings back memories... But what is this,\nall of a sudden?'
'Before, you asked Aoi, to get some glider parts,\ndidn't you?'
'I thought that it might have been you.'
'OK, I have a question!'
Kotori puts her hand straight up.
'Go ahead, missy.'
'...Do you two know each other?'
Ageha and I wanted to ask too, but somehow found\nit hard to ask, whereas Kotori just went straight\nin and did it anyway. Nice.
'Yeah. I graduated from here and Amane was here\nat the same time as me.'
Ageha and I count An-chan's age on our fingers.
'You'd be about the same age...'
An-chan, who had started working, and Amane, who\nwas still a student.
However, there was no mistaking it, these two\nwere the same age.
'We haven't met since I graduated but you're\nstill doing it, aren't you?'
An-chan smiles as he speaks.
'Are you still aiming for it?'
'Yeah.'
'I can't give up until I see the passage of cloud\nwith my own eyes.'
'I see. I remember now...'
Somehow, it feels like we can't join in with this\nconversation.
And then...
'I've cut the watermelon.'
Hotaru put the watermelon on a dish (the one that\nKotori made from FRP) and brought it over.
'It's not cut very well though.'
Because she tried to cut it with a utility knife,\nthe shapes of the slices are a little strange. It\nstill tastes the same though.
Everyone picks up a slice and takes a big bite.
'It's not cold, but it's delicious!'
'It is! Wow, it's really sweet!'
'Have some too, Amane...'
'Thanks.'
Amane takes the slice of watermelon offered to\nher by Hotaru.
'I haven't had watermelon in ages. How many years\nhas it been...?'

As she says that, she seems a little lost as to
how to eat it, and looking round at everyone
else, she copies the way we do it and takes a big
bite.
I also eat it in the same way, taking bites and\nnot worrying about manners. When it's summer,\nyou've just gotta have watermelon.
'What are you doing these days, Tatsuya?'
'I work in the factory at my family's house.'
'Oh, that place... I read about it recently when\nit featured in a magazine.'
'Huh? You were in a magazine, An-chan?'
'Not me. Our factory was in there.'
'What kind of article was it?'
'It was about town factories in Japan that NASA\nhad requested rocket parts from.'
'Town factories make rocket parts??'
'There are some parts that can't be made well by\nmachines. Craftsmen like us make things like\nthat.'
'Do you make them too, An-chan?'
'I helped with the parts that were in the\narticle.'
'Yes, the launch was a success, so they must be\nflying in space right now.'
'The parts that An-chan made are flying through\nspace...?'
That's just so incredible, it feels really\nmysterious.
'Whoa... listening to your story, An-chan, has\nmade me feel all tingly!'
'Kotori, let's get back to work!'
'Yum yum, munch munch... gulp! OK!'
Kotori, who was still halfway through her\nwatermelon, ate the rest of it in one go, and\nwent after Ageha.
'Let's get this baby flying!'
'Yeah!'
'There's a good mood about the place.'
'Yeah. It feels just like old times, right?'
'...It sure does.'
'What do you think of this?'
'...Yeah, it looks good.'
'Ageha, he said it's good!'
'An-chan, look at this.'
'OK, hold on.'
After everyone had eaten the watermelon, An-chan\nand Hotaru helped with the rest of the work in\ngarage.
Having a couple of extra hands was a big help,\nand after all, An-chan is a pro. He showed us how\nto do things, which was really encouraging.
Thanks to that, we got an unexpected amount of\nwork done.
'Just from the work we did today, we've been able\nto shorten the schedule, haven't we?'
'We got about four or five days' work done.'
'This An-chan guy you know, he's unbelievable.\nHow did he get to be like that?'
As we spoke together, Amane was sitting away from\nus, by herself, watching us.
I go over to her for some reason.
'Ha ha ha, it sure is lively, isn't it?'
'This is the first time that this many people\nhave gathered here.'
Amane closes her eyes a little as she smiles\nhappily.
'I see... So you and Tatsuya are childhood\nfriends, huh?'
'I was surprised too. That you and An-chan know\neach other.'
'...Tatsuya is like a senior to you guys, right?\nHe used to be a member of this club.'
'What's that, you say?'
From what I heard of their conversation, I\nthought that might've been the case.
'He graduated first though. The one who restored\nthe cockpit was Tatsuya.'
'He's not like me; he's good with his hands. If\nTatsuya had made them, the main wings would never\nhave broken.'
'Is that so...?'
I didn't know but I had been touching something\nAn-chan had left behind.
'(But why didn't An-chan tell me that he used to\nbe a member of the Soaring Club...?)'
Is it just because he didn't think there was any\nneed to tell me?
Or is there some other reason...?
'Aoi, stop being lazy and come over here and\nhelp!'
'That's right! We're gonna do as much as we can\ntoday!'
'Oh, sorry! OK, I'm gonna go help.'
'Sure.'
As I go to join the circle of people, Amane\nsmiles as she watches me go.
And so, our 'camping' went on late into the\nnight.
'Well then, we'd better head back. Hotaru's got a\ncurfew too.'
An-chan came here in a small truck from the\nfactory and it seems like he's going to drop\nHotaru off on the way home.
'Thanks for today, An-chan. You really helped us\nout.'
'Thank you so much!'
Following Ageha, Kotori also bows her head.
Speaking of which, I've never seen Kotori be so\npolite before...
'Hey, if it's for you guys, I'll help you out\nanytime!'
'Besides, it's like going back to my school days.\nIt was fun.'
'See ya, Amane.'
'Yeah, see ya.'
'Hotaru, can you tell Mom I'll be back late?'
'OK, will do.'
Taking Hotaru with him, An-chan left.
The usual members were still here.
'OK, we'd better get ready to go home.'
'You're right. We've got nothing else to do until\nthe resin dries.'
'Amane, are you going to stay here for a little\nlonger today too?'
'Yeah.'
Amane answers as she goes back to the seat by the\ndrawing board.
'Amane, what time do you usually go home?'
On most days, she stays here working even after\nthe rest of us have gone home.
'Now that you mention it, she's always here\nbefore we are in the mornings.'
'That's true.'
'What time do you get here?'
'Hmm? I dunno.'
She's already got half of her attention on the\ndrawing board, so doesn't really put much effort\ninto her answer.
'Well then...'
'Huh!? Could it be...?'
At that moment, everyone arrived at the same\nanswer.
'Amane, you don't go home, do you?'
'In other words, do you live here?'
'Hmm? Yeah.'
I recalled the conversation I'd had with her a\nfew days ago.
...Yesterday, I went back home for the first time\nages.
Yes, that's what she said.
I misunderstood; I thought that she usually lives\nalone and hadn't been back to her house in a long\ntime.
'My house is far from here. I have a chair and\ndesk, so there's no inconvenience for me.'
'It must be inconvenient, though! There's no bed,\nno bath, no food!'
'If I need a bath, there are the showers in the\ngym, you know? As for food, I can eat the school\ncanteen's food.'
'No, no, the canteen food is only served at\nlunchtime. Also, it's not open during the summer\nholiday...'
I thought that must be why she's always so\nhungry...
'Could it be, Amane, that you've been doing this\nfor a long time...?'
Kotori asks cautiously.
'Hmm? I guess so, yes.'
This is no good... we need to do something about\nthis, quickly.
'...so that's how it is, Mom.'

'You can use the empty rooms however you like.
You're taking care of the place during your
summer holiday, so I don't mind letting you do
something like that.'
'Thanks Mom!'
'Come on in, Amane.'
'Ok, I'm coming in...'
Everyone had forcibly brought Amane to the\ndormitory.
There are a lot of empty rooms here, and since\nmost of the boarders had gone home, it wouldn't\nbe causing much of an inconvenience.
'Flying Fish Manor...'
Amane stares at the entrance lobby, which is far\nmore grand than you would expect for a student\ndormitory.
Speaking of which, it seems that Amane already\nknew about Flying Fish Manor.
That's probably because Isuka was living here\nbefore.
'Kwah! Kwaaaah!'
Sensing that Kotori had come home, Hat came out\nto welcome here.
As usual, he went to sit on Kotori's lap, but...
'Hat? Is that you, Hat?'
'Kwah?'
'Huh?'
Amane goes over to Hat, and starts stroking his\nhead.
'Ah ha ha, you look well, Hat!'
'Gah gah!'
'You're still here then, huh?'
'You know about Hat...?'
'Yes, I do. He was brought here by Isuka.'
'Huh? Really?'
When Kanako was talking about Hat before, she\nsaid it wasn't clear who started keeping Hat\nhere, or when he was first brought here.
So this duck was brought here by Isuka?
It wasn't really a big mystery or anything. But,\nnow that it's been so easily cleared up, Ageha\nseems kind of disappointed.
'Isn't this nice? That you can all live here\ntogether?'
'You should stay here too. There are lots of\nrooms here.'
'Huh? Would that be OK?'
'There's only one room that you can use straight\naway though.'
There are some that I haven't been able to clean,\nso they smell a bit moldy, and there are others\nused as storage space.
There's no air conditioning either, so the living\nconditions in the other rooms would be pretty\nbad.
'I can't stay in Aoi's room... can I?'
'Of course not, we're not kids anymore!'
'But we used to have sleepovers all the time.'
Staying over at each other's houses is something\nwe would always do during the summer holidays.
'In that case...'
'Hmm?'
'...No, it's nothing. Forget it.'
'Don't be like that, tell us what you were gonna\nsay!'
'...Wh-Why don't you stay in my room...?'
'I... take it back! Forget I said anything!'
'Would that be OK?'
'Huh? Ah... umm... It's OK... I don't really\nmind.'
'There's only one bed, but I have a futon for\nwhen Hibari stays over...'
'I'd love to stay over!'
Ageha unexpectedly jumps at the chance, as Kotori\nnervously replies...
'Well, in that case...'
'Alright then. Well, as of today, this is where\nwe'll be lodging.'
And that's how it went.
'This being the case, could you tell Mom,\nHotaru?'
'Yes, that's right. Aoi's place. OK, see you!'
After a late dinner, Ageha got in contact with\nher parents.
She asked Hotaru, who had been taken home already\nby An-chan, to tell them, because she might've\nbeen scolded if she'd told them directly.
Normally it wouldn't be a problem for her to stay\nat the dormitory, but it was kind of out of the\nblue.
'Whew... that was a nice bath!'
said Kanako, who was over there.
'Whoa! She's naked!'
'I'm wearing underwear though.'
'I've told you so many times not to wander around\nlooking like that!'
'But it's hot. Anyway, the bathroom's empty.'
'OK, Ageha and the others can go first. I'll go\nin there last.'
'OK!'
'Oh, yes. I'll leave Kotori with you.'
'What do you mean by that?'
'I...it's fine. You don't need to...'
'You don't need to be shy about it. You're always\nsaying how you want to have a long soak in the\nbath.'
'I'm not shy about it...'
Kotori looked embarrassed, but Ageha didn't ask\nwhat this was all about.
She just pushed Kotori's wheelchair along, like\nit was no big deal.
'Alright, let's go, Kotori.'
'Whaaaat!?'
Kotori was surprised that Ageha was so unfazed\nabout it all.
'Oh... you don't like me pushing you along like\nthis?'
'No, that's not it!'
'Aoi pushes my wheelchair all the time, so I\ndon't really mind.'
'I'm actually quite glad that you want to push my\nwheelchair...'
'If I were you, I would let just about anyone\npush my wheelchair, it beats walking.'
Amane, without realizing, really put her foot in\nher mouth.
'What are you talking about!? If I could walk, I\nwouldn't be in this stupid wheelchair, would I,\nyou idiot!'
'Hauu~'
Amane reeled back like she'd just been flicked\nreally hard in the forehead.
'Oh no... Kotori's angry with me...'
These days, I feel that she's becoming more and\nmore impolite towards Amane. But, it can't really\nbe helped in this case.
'OK, let's all chill out.'
said Ageha, as she looked at Kotori, like she was\ntrying to appease her somehow.
'Sorry, I got a bit carried away there.'
'Hee hee!'
'Well then, let's go to the bathroom. Amane,\nyou're coming too, aren't you?'
'...Yeah, sure.'
The girls followed each other into the bathroom.
As I saw them off, I mumbled to myself...
'(Way to go, Kotori!)'
I kind of felt like a parent watching over his\nchild as she grows up.
'Wow, big baths really are the best, aren't\nthey?'
'It feels great...'
'What's up, Kotori? Why don't you come over\nhere?'
'I said I only needed a shower...'
'C'mon, it's OK. I wanted us to take a bath\ntogether.'
'All the girls, having a nice time in the bath!'
'It's just that you two are... so big... I'm OK\nover here.'
'So big? What do you mean?'
'Well, look at the way they're floating in the\nwater like that! Amane, you eat so much but\nyou're still in such good shape...'
'Most of the calories go to her boobs and her\nbrain, so they're being burned off, no doubt\nabout it.'
'Speaking of which, Ageha, you're the same...\nwhat is it with everyone?'
'Huh? You look nice, Kotori. Your skin is so\nsmooth and pretty.'
'Oh, really? ...Eh heh heh...'
'By the way, Amane. Can I ask you something?'
'What's that?'
'Do you have a boyfriend?'
'A boyfriend?'
'Yes, a boyfriend.'
'Hmm... Nope.'
'No way! You're so beautiful and have such a nice\nfigure, you must be popular, right?'
'Really? I hardly ever leave the garage, so I\ndon't really know.'
'What about that guy, An-chan, who was there\ntoday?'
'Yeah! That's what I thought too!'
'What is exactly is your relationship with\nAn-chan?'
'Tatsuya and I were in the Soaring Club together.\nI don't think of him as my boyfriend though.'
'Even so, when you met each other, there was\nsomething meaningful between the two of you.'
'I thought so too! The two of you are both so\ngood-looking, you'd make a great couple!'
'Tatsuya and I would make a good couple? I've\nnever thought about that before...'
'So, Kotori, do you like Aoi?'
'Whaaaat!!?'
'What's this all of a sudden!? I thought we were\ntalking about you here, Amane!'
'Oh, you're getting all flustered. This is highly\nsuspicious, you know...'
'No, you're wrong! That's not it at all!!'
'Are you sure about that? I think that you and\nAoi make a better couple.'
'Huh, really...? You think so...??'
'Oh, you don't seem as annoyed as I thought you'd\nbe.'
'You've got it all wrong! It's because Amane was\nsaying such weird things... Aww...'
'B...besides, Aoi likes you, doesn't he, Ageha?'
'Hmm? Why do you think that? We're just childhood\nfriends.'
'I heard about it. I heard that in the past, Aoi\nhad confessed his feelings for you.'
'How do you know about that!!? Do you mean to say\nthat Aoi told you about...?'
'It's what that loud-mouthed guy was saying.'
'Ma-bou! That moron... Next time I see him, I'll\npunch him into next week!'
'...So it was true.'
'Geez, no, no. That was when we were just little\nkids, it's not like that at all.'
'It sounds like you've thought that excuse up\nbefore. This is highly suspicious, you know...'
'Urk...! A...at that time, it had already been\ndecided that Aoi was moving away, so I think it's\njust because he suddenly felt lonely.'
'It's really not what you think.'
'Is the reason you turned him down because you\ndon't like him in that way, Ageha?'
'Huh? No, well... it's...'
'Oh! You do like him! Ageha likes Aoi! Ageha\nlikes Aoi!'
'What are you, a little kid or something!?'
'I wonder if Aoi still likes you now?'
'No, I don't think so. Our friendship is going\nreally well though.'
'If I had to say, I think he likes you more,\nKotori.'
'What? No way! If he liked me, he wouldn't karate\nchop me on the top of the head!'
'He never karate chops you, Ageha!'
'I don't know if you can really base it on that,\nthough...'
'So there's no one in particular that he\nlikes...'
'Hmm? Why are you both looking at me?'
'I think that Aoi would probably like you the\nmost, Amane.'
'I agree.'
'The truth is, when Aoi is looking at you from\nafar, I've seen him blushing so many times.'
'Yeah, I've seen that too! Also, when you're\ntalking to him, he gets all nervous and blushes,\nand he seems completely love-struck!'
'He does, he does! She's right, you know!'
'When it comes to joining the Soaring Club, he\nwas very enthusiastic about it right from the\nbeginning.'
'Even though he didn't really know anything about\ngliders.'
'I can understand it if he likes you.'
'I can understand it too.'
'Understand what?'
'Haaaaa...! This huge bath is the greatest!'
'Whew... that felt really good!'
'Whoa... I feel a little dizzy...'
The three girls get out of the bath, stand in\nfront of the electric fan, open the fridge, and\npour some barley tea.
'You were in the bath for a really long time,\nweren't you? I could hear voices coming from\ninside. What were you talking about?'
From the hallway, I could hear laughing, and\nscreaming coming from the bathroom from time to\ntime.
I couldn't catch exactly what they were saying\nbut it sounded like they were getting pretty\nexcited about something.
'It's a secret! Right, Kotori?'
'Glug glug glug... That's right. No boys\nallowed.'
I worry when they say it like that. What the hell\nwere they talking about?
'Well then, shall we get ready for bed?'
'OK!'
I hear Kotori's wheelchair squeaking as she moves\noff behind me, and Ageha goes with her.
'OK then, goodnight!'
'Goodnight.'
'Yeah, goodnight.'
I watch them leave and then run myself a bath.
'Amane, are you going to bed too? I just finished\ngetting your room ready.'
'Hmm? Yeah.'

Amane had already laid the plans out on the
dining hall table, and was holding a glass of
milk in one hand while looking at the designs she
was holding in the other.
It seemed like she wouldn't hear me whatever I\nsaid, so I decided to go ahead and take a bath.
